00: System healthy and functioning properly. If steady, reset the system or replace the CPU showing the code.
01: Check CCC card placement; replace CCC or faulty CPU if swapping identifies the issue.
02: Check CCC card placement; replace CCC or faulty CPU as needed.
05: Check address jumpers of UFSBI units; replace faulty CPU if needed.
06: Check address jumpers of UFSBI units; replace faulty CPU if necessary.
07: Change CCC card; reset system if UFSBI is in 2/2 mode.
08: Swap CPU to isolate the issue; replace CCC or CPU as necessary.
0A: Reset system; address 'start' command timing issues.
0B: Press 'BI-ON' button to start the system within 30 seconds. If steady, reset the system or replace CPU.
0C: Wait for all CPUs to display '0B' during the POST process.
10: Manually reset the system. Swap Input Card 1 with another and observe the outcome. Replace Input Card 1 if required.
11: Manually reset the system. Swap Input Card 2 with another and observe the outcome. Replace Input Card 2 if required.
12: Manually reset the system. Swap Input Card 3 with another and observe the outcome. Replace Input Card 3 if required.
13: Manually reset the system. Swap Input Card 4 with another and observe the outcome. Replace Input Card 4 if required.
14: Manually reset the system. Swap Input Card 5 with another and observe the outcome. Replace Input Card 5 if required.
15: Manually reset the system. Swap Input Card 6 with another and observe the outcome. Replace Input Card 6 if required.
16: Manually reset the system. Swap Input Card 7 with another and observe the outcome. Replace Input Card 7 if required.
17: Manually reset the system. Swap Input Card 8 with another and observe the outcome. Replace Input Card 8 if required.
18: Manually reset the system. Check relay connections for faults. Replace Output Card 1 if needed.
19: Manually reset the system. Check relay connections for faults. Replace Output Card 2 if needed.
1A: Manually reset the system. Check relay connections for faults. Replace Output Card 3 if needed.
1B: Manually reset the system. Check relay connections for faults. Replace Output Card 4 if needed.

1F: Manually reset the system. Check relay connections for faults. Replace Output Card 8 if needed.
20: Manually reset the system. Swap Input Card 9 with another and observe the outcome. Replace Input Card 9 if required.
21: Manually reset the system. Swap Input Card 10 with another and observe the outcome. Replace Input Card 10 if required.
22: Manually reset the system. Swap Input Card 11 with another and observe the outcome. Replace Input Card 11 if required.

26: Manually reset the system. Swap Input Card 15 with another and observe the outcome. Replace Input Card 15 if required.
27: Manually reset the system. Swap Input Card 16 with another and observe the outcome. Replace Input Card 16 if required.
28: Manually reset the system. Check relay connections for faults. Replace Output Card 9 if needed.
29: Manually reset the system. Check relay connections for faults. Replace Output Card 10 if needed.
2A: Manually reset the system. Check relay connections for faults. Replace Output Card 11 if needed.
2B: Manually reset the system. Check relay connections for faults. Replace Output Card 12 if needed.
2C: Manually reset the system. Check relay connections for faults. Replace Output Card 13 if needed.

2E: Manually reset the system. Check relay connections for faults. Replace Output Card 15 if needed.
2F: Manually reset the system. Check relay connections for faults. Replace Output Card 16 if needed.
30: Manually reset the system. Check relay connections for faults in BIPR1.
31: Manually reset the system. Check relay connections for faults in BIPR2.
33: Check communication link from crone box to modem. Restart modem or replace CCC card.
34: Check the channel, modem, and communication link. Ensure the other system shows error 33.
37: Replace CPU card with static error code. If all CPUs show the code, replace CCC card.
38: Replace CPU-B card. If all CPUs show the code, replace CCC card.
39: Replace CPU-C card. If all CPUs show the code, replace CCC card.
3A: Change the communication card and reset the system.
40: Manually reset the system. Check relay placement, wiring, and remove short circuits.

90: Check BIPR relays, Input Card 1 placement, and voltage.
92: Verify UFSBI address jumpers are properly set and secured.
93: Replace faulty CPU card or output card to resolve GAL mismatch.
95: Change Output Card 1 to resolve GAL mismatch during POST checking.
96: Change Output Card 2 to resolve GAL mismatch during POST checking.
99: Press 'RESET' and 'BI-OK' after power cycling the system.
A0: Swap or replace faulty CPU card. Replace CCC card if needed.
A1: Swap or replace faulty CPU card. Replace CCC card if needed.
A2: Swap or replace faulty CPU card. Replace CCC card if needed.
A3: Swap or replace faulty CPU card. Replace CCC card if needed.
A4: Swap or replace faulty CPU card. Replace CCC card if needed.
A5: Swap or replace faulty CPU card. Replace CCC card if needed.
A6: Swap or replace faulty CPU card. Replace CCC card if needed.
AA: Check CPU and Output Card 1 for faults during normal operation.
AB: Swap or replace faulty CPU and Output Card 2.
B0: Perform Power-On-Reset. Replace CPU card if fault persists.
B5: Swap Input card from faulty slot. Replace CPU card if needed.
C9: Reset the system to address data bus errors. Replace CCC card if needed.
FA: Reset the system and replace CCC card if fault persists.
FD: Reset the system and replace faulty CPU card or CCC card.
FE: Reset the system and replace faulty CPU card or CCC card.
